newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine soldiers kill 21 Moslem rebels in raid.
newsitem.headline: Philippine soldiers kill 21 Moslem rebels in raid.

text.p: About 21 Moslem rebels were killed after their camp in the southern Philippines was overrun by government soldiers, army officials said on Saturday.
The rebel camp is located just outside the hilly Tipo-Tipo town in Basilan Island, 900 km (560 miles) south of Manila.

Major Valentin Edang, commanding officer of the 51st Infantry Battalion of the Philippine Army, said they attacked the camp of a Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) faction after local residents reported that armed groups had been demanding money from them.
The rebels also tried to attack a military detachment in the area.
Thirteen soldiers were wounded in the attack on the camp, including Edang.

The armed group is being disowned by MILF leaders who are presently preparing to talk peace with the government. The main rebel group, the Moro National Liberation Front, recently signed a peace agreement with the government.
Edang said a naval blockade had been set up around the island.
